original_title: Sri Lanka IMF program approved by Executive Board: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund has approved Sri Lanka’s program, Foreign Minister Ali Sabry said.

IMF board has approved our EFF. It’s been a long road but thanks to everyone's hard work and dedication, we're well on our way towards better days ! Thank you all creditors and the President for his relentless pursuit of this vital mission !
Sri Lanka is expected to get the equivalent of a 2.9 billion US dollar loan. A part of the funds are to be released for budget financing.

“The IMF executive board approved Sri Lanka’s program under the Extended Fund Facility, that will enable Sri Lanka to access up to $7 billion in funding,” President Ranil Wickremsinghe’s media office said.
“The President committed to full transparency in all discussions with financial institutions and creditors…”
Sri Lanka is going to the IMF for the 17 the time, after the central bank printed money and triggered the worst currency crisis in its history.
